The Execution Gap Erik Wilde: Strategy and Business Alignment

(5) Vision → Strategy → Program → Platform → Results



The Execution Gap Erik Wilde: Strategy and Business Alignment

(6) Digital Transformation Definition

Digital Transformation means adapting an organization's strategy and structure to capture opportunities enabled by digital technology. (Nathan Furr and Andrew Shipilov, Digital Doesn't Have to Be Disruptive, Harvard Business Review 97(4), July/August 2019, pp. 94-103) [https://hbr.org/2019/07/digital-doesnt-have-to-be-disruptive]



The Execution Gap Erik Wilde: Strategy and Business Alignment

(7) Leadership 1-2-3-4

  • Set a vision as the goal to improve the organization
    • APIs are one of the necessary foundations of any digital value stream
  • Define a strategy how to turn the vision into reality
    • APIs must focus on business value for them to become valuable building blocks
  • Have a program to turn the defined strategy into reality
    • Designing and building valuable APIs has business, organizational, and technical aspects
  • Build a platform that supports teams and supports scaling
    • Platform engineering focuses on increasing efficiency and flow of teams


The Bezos Mandate

Outline (The Bezos Mandate)

The Bezos Mandate Erik Wilde: Strategy and Business Alignment

(9) Jeff Bezos' Services Rant: The Rules [https://gist.github.com/chitchcock/1281611]

  • Famous small set of SOA design rules
    • Teams must expose functionality through services
    • Communication happens only through service interfaces
    • There are no hard guidelines for service design
    • Internal/external service is a matter of policy, not one of design
  • Going against the let's pick a platform spirit of old-school SOA


The Bezos Mandate Erik Wilde: Strategy and Business Alignment

(10) Jeff Bezos' Services Rant: The Consequences [https://gist.github.com/chitchcock/1281611]

  • With more freedom comes more responsibility
    • Monitoring and metrics are necessary for finding root causes
    • All APIs must be hardened against DoS attacks
    • Automated QA is necessary to really understand service health
    • Services must be documented and registered so that they can be discovered
    • Debugging becomes harder because of service dependencies
  • Sophisticated tooling required to manage the new SOA landscape
  • Much easier in today's technology landscape than in 2002


The Bezos Mandate Erik Wilde: Strategy and Business Alignment

(11) API First: API all the Things

  • Jeff Bezos' Mandate [Jeff Bezos' Services Rant: The Rules [https://gist.github.com/chitchcock/1281611] (1)] focuses on API products
    • Loose coupling means to look at products as APIs
    • All dependencies have to be designed and built as APIs
  • API products are built by thinking about interactions
    1. The API is the first UI
    2. APIs are designed before anything is implemented
    3. APIs are the primary means of team communications


Three Pillars

Outline (Three Pillars)

  1. Stakeholder Management [0]
  2. API Strategy [11]

Three Pillars Erik Wilde: Strategy and Business Alignment

(13) Business Pillar

  • Increase delivery speed of capabilities and products
  • Decrease cost of product development and adaptation
  • Improve insight into products and value chains
  • Aligning/unifying business and IT: Business, rewritten by software™


Three Pillars Erik Wilde: Strategy and Business Alignment

(14) Organizational Pillar

  • Increased team autonomy increases team delivery speed
  • Structures across teams build communities of practice
  • API support and platform provided by Center for Enablement (C4E)
  • Team practices inform and form the API guidelines
Any organization that designs a system will produce a design whose structure is a copy of the organization's communication structure. [http://www.melconway.com/Home/Conways_Law.html] (Mel Conway [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Melvin_Conway])


Three Pillars Erik Wilde: Strategy and Business Alignment

(15) Technology Pillar

  • Constrain what products have to do (not how)
  • No hidden channels bypassing the API strategy
  • API guidelines for protocols, patterns, and practices
  • Lifecycle for technology maturity and support


Three Pillars Erik Wilde: Strategy and Business Alignment

(16) API Strategy = Pillars × Perspectives

External Internal
Biz
  • API monetization
  • Revenue-supporting APIs
  • Increase speed & feedback
  • Identify & stabilize enablers
  • Design for externalization
  • Increase biz insight with dashboards
Org
  • Focus on documentation/DX
  • Support discovery/self-service
  • Collect DX feedback
  • Products > projects (ownership)
  • Team enablement/support
  • Loose coupling for speed/agility
Tech
  • Tech trends and popularity
  • Invest in on-boarding support
  • Secure through platform
  • Loosely coupled implementations
  • Observe patterns and practices
  • Establish C4E for platform/support


Three Pillars Erik Wilde: Strategy and Business Alignment

(17) Got Strategy?

  • There is no one-size-fits-all API Strategy
  • Strategy always depends on context
    • What do you want to improve/achieve with APIs?
    • What does your organization look like?
    • What is the main value that you produce?
    • What does the market look like?
    • What do your customers look like?
    • What do your partners look like?
    • What does your competition look like?

(21) The Five Billion Dollar API



API Business Models Erik Wilde: Strategy and Business Alignment

(22) The API Monetization Myth

  • Don't think about a business model for your API
  • Do think about new opportunities for your business
  • Do think about an API for your business model


API Business Models Erik Wilde: Strategy and Business Alignment

(28) The 900lb Gorilla



API Business Models Erik Wilde: Strategy and Business Alignment

(29) Most API Value Creation is Indirect

  1. Using APIs to become better at internal reuse and cross-pollination
  2. Reducing friction by having teams communicate via APIs
  3. Using API First as a way to build everything as digital building blocks
